import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import warnings as ws
ws.filterwarnings("ignore")
source.e2e99ac8:
sns.set()
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize =(10,10))
ax = sns.countplot(y = df.publication, palette="Pastel1")
ax.set_ylabel("Categories")
ax.set_xlabel("Count of Articles")
plt.title("The Distribution of Publication", fontsize = 20)
plt.show()
source.992eae58:
sns.set()
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize =(10,6))
ax = sns.scatterplot (x = "reading_time", y = "claps", data = df,hue = "publication")
ax.set_xlabel("Reading time for article (in minute)")
ax.set_ylabel("Claps for the Article")
plt.title("Reading time to claps ratio", fontsize = 20)
plt.show()

source.2b137323:
temp = df.groupby("publication")["reading_time"].mean().reset_index()
sns.set()
plt.figure(figsize = (15,6))
plt.title("Average time for the topics ", size = 20)
sns.barplot(x="publication", y  = "reading_time", data = temp, palette="Spectral")
plt.show()

source.2ea28a81:
plt.figure(figsize = (8,8))
sns.scatterplot(y="reading_time", x="responses", data = df, hue= "publication")
plt.title("Reponse of people", size = 20)
plt.show()
source.4c966f7e:
temp = df.groupby("publication")["responses"].count().reset_index()
sns.set()
plt.figure(figsize = (15,6))
plt.title("Responses of People for the topics ", size = 20)
sns.barplot(x="publication", y  = "responses", data = temp, palette="coolwarm")
plt.show()

source.81b54778: An article on the medium.com may have the descriptive subtitle or may not. It is totally optional content which is depend on the author wheather he/she insert or not hence there is no any benifit of replacing the NA Values in the subtitle column. Hence we will keep it as it is and move forward to futhur analysis
source.48960e2d: Most important aspect of the any article is the interaction of the people. The people tends to react most to the articles which are short and concise. The concise Articles also denote the akill of the writer. Hence it is also a good inference for any blogger that is they are looking for blogging they must keep their articl concise and representative
source.e69fdf2b: Below graph gives us conclusion that, from the list of the above mentioned publications the all topics has the articles which requires the average reading time of 4 - 8 mins. But the topic Better Humans (which is a kind of self help topic) requires the more time.

source.4c171030: As we exprected, the articles on medium.com have the good amount of claps (appreciation) if they are of the quite good and average length. The article should not be too long. Hence, if you are looking to start blogging over there then you must keep eye on it.
